resources.string: Privacy isn‚Äôt default. Take it back with De1984 Firewall and Package Control.
Welcome to De1984! Would you like to start the firewall now to protect your privacy?
‚ö†Ô∏è Stopping the firewall will allow all apps to access the internet.\n\nYour privacy protection will be disabled until you turn the firewall back on.
WARNING: A VPN is currently active!
Please allow your VPN app in the firewall to avoid connectivity issues.
This will %1$s mobile data access for %2$s
Remove this app from your device
‚ö†Ô∏è This is a system package. Force stopping it may cause system instability.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
This will immediately stop all processes for %s.\n\nAre you sure?
‚ö†Ô∏è This is a system package. Disabling it may cause system instability or prevent other apps from working.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
This will allow %s to run normally.\n\nAre you sure?
This will prevent %s from running.\n\nAre you sure?
Show notifications for new app installations
Prevents Android from killing the firewall service to save battery. Critical for VPN reliability.
Full system access for advanced operations
Allows automatic fallback to VPN when privileged backends (iptables/ConnectivityManager) fail. Ensures firewall stays active.
View installed packages and basic information
Prevents Android from killing the firewall service to save battery. Critical for VPN reliability.
Package management and system-level operations (via Shizuku or root)
Allows automatic fallback to VPN when privileged backends (iptables/ConnectivityManager) fail. Ensures firewall stays active.
Not needed when using privileged firewall backend (iptables/ConnectivityManager). Only required as fallback.
Important/Essential packages must be uninstalled individually
Maximum 50 packages can be selected at once
Multi-select not available for disabled packages
Multi-select not available for uninstalled packages
Maximum %d packages can be selected at once
This will change network access for %d apps.
Late nights for brighter days.\nCreated by Doru Moraru
Root permission was denied. Follow the instructions below to grant access.
Your device is not rooted. Root access is required for advanced package management operations.
‚Ä¢ Reinstall the app to trigger the permission dialog again\n‚Ä¢ Or manually add De1984 to your superuser app (Magisk, KernelSU, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Magisk - Most popular and widely supported root solution. Works on Android 5.0+ and supports modules for additional features.\n‚Ä¢ KernelSU - Modern kernel-based root management. Provides better security isolation and doesn\'t modify system partition.\n‚Ä¢ APatch - Newer alternative with kernel patching approach. Good for devices with strict security policies.

To enable package disable/enable functionality:

1. Root your device using your preferred method
2. Grant superuser access to De1984 when prompted
3. Restart the app to use advanced operations
Advanced operations are available via Shizuku
Shizuku permission was denied. Tap \'Grant Shizuku Permission\' to try again.
Shizuku is not installed. Install Shizuku to enable package management without root.
Shizuku is installed but not running. Start Shizuku to enable package management.
Start Shizuku app to enable package management
Shizuku allows apps to use system APIs with elevated privileges (ADB or root). It\'s a safer alternative to traditional root access for package management.
No privileged access available. Install Shizuku or root your device to enable package management.
Shizuku is installed but not running. Start Shizuku or root your device to enable package management.
Shizuku or root access required for package management
Waiting for Shizuku to start. Tap to retry.
Waiting for Shizuku permission. Tap to retry.
Shizuku is now available. Switching to preferred backend‚Ä¶
De1984 Firewall is now using ConnectivityManager backend
De1984 Firewall is now using iptables backend
De1984 Firewall failed to switch backend. Still using VPN.
De1984 Firewall failed to switch backend
Privileged backend failed. Tap to enable VPN fallback and restore firewall protection.
Another VPN is active. De1984 needs VPN permission to restore firewall protection. This will replace your current VPN connection. Tap to grant permission.
Allows automatic fallback to VPN when privileged backends (iptables/ConnectivityManager) fail. Ensures firewall stays active.
Create VPN connection for firewall fallback
Choose your preferred language for the app

Privacy isn\'t the default. Take it back with De1984 Firewall and Package Control. A truly free and open-source project made with ‚ô•Ô∏è for privacy. Consider donating to support its development if you find it useful.
Select which backend to use for blocking apps
Requires root or Shizuku in root mode
For Android 12 and below (use ConnectivityManager on Android 13+)
This backend is not available on your device.
Might speed up the app when disabled
Block all network traffic during device startup until firewall activates (requires root)
Show notifications when new apps with network permissions are installed
Show uninstall option for Essential and Important packages
Allow blocking network access for system-critical and VPN packages
Show a prompt to start the firewall when the app opens and firewall is inactive
Show confirmation dialog when tapping network icons to toggle rules
Adapt app colors to match your device wallpaper (Android 12+). Requires app restart.
Save and restore your firewall rules
Export and import the list of uninstalled system packages
‚ùå Root or Shizuku required to export uninstalled apps

Found %1$d packages to uninstall:

%2$s

‚ö†Ô∏è This will uninstall all listed apps.

Captive portal detection is completely disabled
Google\'s default captive portal detection servers
Use your own custom captive portal URLs
Root or Shizuku access required to modify settings
Get involved and help improve De1984
Contribute code, report bugs, or suggest features to make this app better for everyone.

üí° AUTO Mode (Recommended)
Automatically selects the best available backend:
1. iptables (if root/Shizuku available)
2. ConnectivityManager (if Shizuku + Android 13+)
3. VPN (fallback)

De1984 supports four firewall backends:

üîπ VPN Backend
‚Ä¢ Always available (no root required)
‚Ä¢ Uses Android VpnService API
‚Ä¢ Supports granular control (WiFi/Mobile/Roaming)
‚Ä¢ Occupies VPN slot (can't use other VPN apps)
‚Ä¢ User-space packet filtering

üîπ iptables Backend
‚Ä¢ Requires root or Shizuku in root mode
‚Ä¢ Kernel-level blocking (most efficient)
‚Ä¢ Supports granular control (WiFi/Mobile/Roaming)
‚Ä¢ Doesn't occupy VPN slot
‚Ä¢ Works with other VPN apps

üîπ ConnectivityManager Backend
‚Ä¢ Requires Shizuku + Android 13+
‚Ä¢ System-level blocking (blocks all networks reliably)
‚Ä¢ All-or-nothing blocking only (no granular control)
‚Ä¢ Doesn't occupy VPN slot
‚Ä¢ Works with other VPN apps

üîπ NetworkPolicyManager Backend (Legacy)
‚Ä¢ Requires Shizuku
‚Ä¢ For Android 12 and below
‚Ä¢ May not block WiFi on some devices
‚Ä¢ Use ConnectivityManager on Android 13+ instead
‚Ä¢ Doesn't occupy VPN slot
üîÑ Testing privileged access...\n\nPlease grant permission in the popup dialog if prompted.

üì¶ Backup Information:

‚Ä¢ Created: %1$s
‚Ä¢ App Version: %2$s
‚Ä¢ Rules Count: %3$d

Choose restore mode:

‚Ä¢ Merge: Keep existing rules and add/update from backup
‚Ä¢ Replace All: Delete all existing rules first (‚ö†Ô∏è destructive)

This will DELETE all existing firewall rules and replace them with the backup.

This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure?
This allows uninstalling system-critical packages that may brick your device. Only enable if you know what you\'re doing.\n\nAre you sure you want to enable this?

This allows blocking network access for system-critical packages (WiFi, Bluetooth, Download Manager, etc.) and VPN apps.

Blocking these packages may:
‚Ä¢ Break network connectivity
‚Ä¢ Prevent WiFi/Bluetooth from working
‚Ä¢ Cause VPN reconnection issues
‚Ä¢ Require factory reset or ADB to fix

Only enable if you know what you're doing.

Are you sure you want to enable this?
The app needs to restart to apply the new color theme. Restart now?
This will restore your device\'s original captive portal settings that were captured when you first opened this feature.
This will reset captive portal settings to Google\'s default servers. Your original settings will remain saved and can be restored later.
Open source licenses screen coming soon
Using VPN-based firewall because your device is not rooted or doesn\'t have Shizuku. You cannot use another VPN app while De1984 Firewall is active.
Let app access internet when in background
Your device uses a system-level firewall that doesn\'t support per-network blocking. For granular control, root access is required.
‚ö†Ô∏è System Critical Package - Network access cannot be modified to prevent system instability.
üîí VPN App - Always allowed to prevent VPN reconnection issues after device lock/unlock.
‚ö†Ô∏è Critical package protection is disabled in Settings. Blocking network access may cause system instability or VPN issues.

‚ÑπÔ∏è This app currently has no internet permission declared in its manifest.\n\nBlocking it now will take effect if the app gains internet permission in a future update, providing proactive protection.
This system-critical package is protected by default to prevent system instability. Enable \'Allow Firewall Critical Packages\' in Settings to modify network access.
This VPN app is protected by default to prevent VPN reconnection issues. Enable \'Allow Firewall Critical Packages\' in Settings to modify network access.
This package is protected by default. Enable \'Allow Firewall Critical Packages\' in Settings to modify network access.
This critical package is protected by default to prevent system instability. Enable \'Allow Uninstalling Critical Packages\' in Settings to uninstall it.
This package is protected. Enable the setting in Settings to modify network access.
This package is protected. Enable the setting in Settings to uninstall.

‚ö†Ô∏è ESSENTIAL SYSTEM PACKAGE ‚ö†Ô∏è

Uninstalling %1$s WILL BRICK YOUR DEVICE!

This package is critical for system operation. Removing it will make your device unusable and may require a factory reset or reflashing.

%2$sType "UNINSTALL" to confirm this dangerous action:

Uninstalling %1$s will cause major system features to stop working.

%2$sThis may require a factory reset to restore functionality.

Are you sure?
This will remove %s from your device.\n\nAre you sure?

‚úì Safe to remove

This package is considered bloatware and can be safely uninstalled.

Are you sure?

‚ö†Ô∏è DANGER: This is a system package. Uninstalling it may brick your device or cause severe system instability.

This action cannot be easily undone.

Are you absolutely sure?
This will remove %s from your device.\n\nAre you sure?
This will restore the system app to your device.\n\nAre you sure?

Reinstall %1$d selected system app%2$s?

The following apps will be reinstalled:
Are you sure you want to uninstall these %d apps?

‚ùå No Privileged Access Available

Your device does not appear to be rooted. To enable advanced package management features:
‚Ä¢ Install and configure Shizuku (recommended - no root required)
‚Ä¢ Or root your device using Magisk, KernelSU, or APatch

‚ùå Root Access Denied

Your device is rooted but De1984 was denied superuser permission.

To grant access:
‚Ä¢ Open your superuser app (Magisk, KernelSU, APatch, etc.) and grant permission to De1984
‚Ä¢ If the permission prompt doesn't appear, uninstall and reinstall the app, then grant permission when prompted at first launch
‚Ä¢ Or manually add De1984 to your superuser app (Magisk, KernelSU, etc.)
Switching to VPN backend will disconnect your current VPN connection (e.g., Proton VPN, NordVPN, etc.).\n\nDo you want to continue?
VPN permission denied. Reverting to AUTO mode.
No privileged access available. Install Shizuku or root your device to enable package management.
Shizuku is installed but not running. Start Shizuku or root your device to enable package management.
Shizuku or root access required for package management

%s was installed. Tap to configure firewall rules.

Unable to enable package. Shizuku or root access required for package management.
Unable to disable package. Shizuku or root access required for package management.
Unable to uninstall package. Shizuku or root access required for package management.
Unable to reinstall package. Shizuku or root access required for package management.
Unable to force stop package. Shizuku or root access required for package management.
Unable to allow network access. Root access required for firewall operations.
Unable to block network access. Root access required for firewall operations.
Failed to reset to Google defaults

This will block ALL network traffic during device boot until De1984 starts.

‚ö†Ô∏è If De1984 fails to start, your device will have no network.

Recovery Options:
1. Open De1984 ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Disable Boot Protection ‚Üí Reboot
2. If that doesn't work, use ADB:
 adb shell
 su
 rm /data/adb/post-fs-data.d/de1984_boot_protection.sh
 reboot
Network traffic will no longer be blocked during boot. Apps may leak data before firewall starts.\n\nNote: This change will take effect on your next reboot.
Store logs to file for debugging. Logs are not sent anywhere.
‚ÑπÔ∏è Debug build - logging enabled by default
This will delete existing log entries.
No logs yet. Enable logging and use the app to generate logs.
Logging disabled. New logs won\'t be recorded.
De1984 firewall is active using %s backend
